name: Sloper Hanging
how_to_perform:
1. Find a sturdy sloping bar or ledge that is high enough for your body, ideally with an overhang of about 20-30 inches.
2. Approach the sloper and position yourself with both hands on the starting holds, gripping them firmly as you would in a pull-up.
3. From this point, fully extend yourself and reach outwards into the gap, keeping your body flat and your legs straight.
4. Engage your core muscles to support your body position, keeping your hips down and preventing swinging or swaying motions in your upper body.
5. Hold the position for as long as possible, maintaining control and focus to develop strength and stability.
6. When you're ready to release, slowly lower yourself back down to a controlled stop.
short_summary: Sloper hanging is an advanced upper body exercise that focuses on building strength in the hands, shoulders, and core muscles by performing a prolonged hang from a sloping bar or ledge.
